intro: Impatiens mankulamensis, commonly known as the Mankulam Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
